problem_summary_simple: Find the minimum time to revert a string to its initial state by repeatedly removing and adding k characters.
problem_summary_technical: Employ the Z-function to identify the longest common prefix starting at multiples of k.
key_insights: The Z-function is crucial for efficiently finding prefixes that match suffixes.
The problem boils down to finding the smallest `i` (multiple of `k`) where `word[i:]` matches `word`.
The constraints on `n` (up to 10^6) necessitate an O(n) solution, making the Z-function ideal.
